page.title: 12Tourism around Scoutmoor.
page.content: The building of the M66 motorway meant that many properties were demolished to make way for the routeway. Nevertheless, several footbridges were built to ensure that the various footpaths and walks, including the Rossendale Way, were maintained. Bury Old Road is part of an ancient highway which can still be traced from Bury to Rawtenstall and which was in use until the new turnpike road was built at the beginning of the 19th Century. The Rossendale Way itself passes into Bleakholt Road turning right onto Rochdale Road at Turn Village. From here follow the steps leading up to a stile below a restored farmhouse. Beyond this the path climbs the shoulder of Scoutmoor. On a clear day Greater Manchester and the hills of the Peak District can be seen.
